org.mobilesynergies.android.epic.service
Class EpicService

java.lang.Object
  Service
      org.mobilesynergies.android.epic.service.EpicService

public class EpicService
extends Service

The service running as a background process on Android. It offers two interfaces:

  • An interface for 3rd party applications to bind to (see EpicServiceApplicationInterface).
  • An interface for activities that configure the service or show the status of the service (see EpicServiceAdministrationInterface).
The EpicService class is responsible to establish a connection to the epic network when possible. It handles changes in network (internet) availability and manages the XMPP client.

registerServiceStatusChangeCallback

public void registerServiceStatusChangeCallback(org.mobilesynergies.android.epic.service.interfaces.IServiceStatusChangeCallback callback)
The applicaiton can register a callback to be informed about changes of service availability. The callback is called either when the connection to the xmpp server was established and the user authentication suceeded or when the connection to the xmpp server was lost or the user logged out.

Parameters:
callback - The callback that will be notified about changes

addSession

public void addSession(String applicationKey,
                       ApplicationSession appSession)
Is called by the ApplicationInterfaceImplementation to add an ApplicationSession. The application is verified to have the rights to connect to the epic service.

Parameters:
applicationKey - The key that will be used by the application to identify itself.
appSession - The session object holding the details of this applcication session.

getApplicationSessions

public ApplicationSession getApplicationSessions(String sessionKey)
This function is called to get a ApplicationSession object.

Parameters:
sessionKey -
Returns:
The ApplicationSession object identified by the sessionKey or null if the sessionKey is unknown.
